entry.title: Georgia woman's execution postponed again; first weather, now cloudy drugs
entry.summary: The execution drug was sent to an independent lab to check its potency and the test came back at an acceptable level, but during subsequent checks it appeared cloudy, Georgia Department of Corrections spokeswoman Gwendolyn Hogan said.

entry.title: Cloudy execution drug was too cold, not tainted, Georgia officials say
entry.summary: Georgia has also suspended the execution of another condemned inmate, Brian Keith Terrell, while an analysis of the drug supply was conducted.

entry.title: Pharmacy expert: Problem with Georgia execution drug caused by storage at low temperature
Expert: Georgia execution drug problem cause by low temp
Georgia waffles on execution with cloudy drug, lawyers say
Georgia halts execution of state's only female death row inmate
entry.summary: Gissendaner's execution by injection was reset for Monday night at a prison in Jackson, Ga., after a winter storm prompted state officials to postpone it last week.

entry.title: Georgia halts execution of state's only female death row inmate
Concerns over drug prompt delay of Georgia woman's execution
entry.summary: Georgia and other death penalty states have bought execution drugs from compounding pharmacies in recent years after pharmaceutical companies stopped selling to U.S. prisons.

entry.title: Concerns over drug prompt delay of Georgia woman's execution
entry.summary: Gissendaner was scheduled to be executed Monday, March 2, 2015, but citing concerns about the drug to be used in a lethal injection, corrections officials in Georgia postponed Gissendaner's execution for the second time in a week.

entry.title: Georgia halts execution of state's only female death row inmate: newspaper
entry.summary: "Within the hours leading up to the scheduled execution, the Execution Team performed the necessary checks. At that time, the drugs appeared cloudy," Georgia Department of Corrections spokeswoman Gwendolyn Hogan said in a statement.

entry.title: Execution of Georgia woman postponed; problem with drug
entry.summary:
(AP) - Georgia postponed its first execution of a woman in 70 years late Monday, as officials cited problems with the lone drug that would be used for the lethal injection.

The drug, pentobarbital, had a cloudy appearance, prompting officials to call a pharmacist and then out of an "abundance of caution" to postpone the execution, said Georgia Department of Corrections spokeswoman Gwendolyn Hogan.

An appellate court had rejected the lawyers' request for a delay on the grounds that Georgia's lethal-injection procedures aren't transparent enough to be challenged in court.

entry.title: Execution of Georgia Woman Postponed; Problem With Drug
Georgia postpones its 1st execution of a woman in 70 years, citing problem with injection drug
entry.summary: (AP) - Georgia postpones its 1st execution of a woman in 70 years, citing problem with injection drug.

entry.title: Georgia woman nears execution for husband's murder
